title: 107_hr537
content: The National Commission on Youth Crime and School Violence is established to make recommendations on deterring youth crime and protecting children from violence in schools. The National Commission on Youth Crime and School Violence consists of 8 members appointed by various officials for life, with vacancies being filled as needed. The National Commission on Youth Crime and School Violence consists of 8 members appointed for life, with vacancies filled in the same manner. The Chairperson is elected by members, and pay and travel expenses are provided for Commission members. The National Commission on Youth Crime and School Violence operates in accordance with sections 5702 and 5703 of title 5, United States Code. The National Commission on Youth Crime and School Violence operates in accordance with sections 5702 and 5703 of title 5, United States Code. SEC. 4. DIRECTOR AND STAFF. The Commission appoints a Director without regard to certain regulations and pays them at level IV of the Executive Schedule. The Director can hire additional staff with Commission approval, following certain civil service laws for appointments and pay rates. The Commission appoints a Director at level IV of the Executive Schedule and can hire staff following civil service laws for appointments and pay rates. Federal agencies can detail personnel to assist the Commission, and the Administrator of General Services provides administrative support services on a reimbursable basis. The Commission has the power to hold meetings, hearings, and sessions as needed. It can obtain official data from US departments and agencies and use the US mails for communication. The Commission established by this Act must submit an interim report within 6 months and a final report by Dec. 31, 2002, containing findings, conclusions, and recommendations. The Commission will terminate 15 days after submitting the final report.
